New Records: Jayson Tatum has reached 16 points in the first quarter for the third time in eight games this season, a feat no other player in the league has achieved more than once.
Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum erupted for 26 points in the first half, guiding Boston to a 22-point advantage at the break.
Tatum became more of a facilitator in the second half, scoring just two points but handing out five of his nine assists during the frame.
Pre-Game Insights: Jayson Tatum said he made the call on Monday to wear the headband, as it's a running tradition between him and Derrick White.
Post-Match Reflections: Tatum said heâ€™s trying to start the game off more aggressive, whereas in earlier years, he would ease into the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics won their first 30-point victory of the season, finishing with a 123-93 win over the Hawks.
Jayson Tatum and Derrick White made their headgear season debut by wearing headbands in unison.
Others: Jaylen Brown was sidelined for the second straight game with a strained left hip flexor.
Tatum has averaged a league-high 13.3 points per first quarter this season, accounting for nearly half of his scoring average.
